alert.note: Alert for Somerset (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 15 at 11:29PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM EDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of west central Maine, including the following county, Somerset. * WHEN...Until 200 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1129 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. This will cause small stream flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Jackman, Seboomook, Soldiertown, Brassua, Town Of Thorndike, Alder Brook, Pittston Academy Grant, Hammond, Long Pond and Tomhegan.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
